Title: China imposes retaliatory tariffs on the US, LNG impacted further
Description: China has retaliated against the new US tariffs announced on Apr.2 by President Donald Trump, by imposing a reciprocal 34% tariff on all imported goods originating in the US, which is expected to further discourage Chinese buyers from purchasing US LNG.
Author: JS

Title: China’s LNG imports pick up in March, but remain below year-earlier levels
Description: China’s LNG imports rebounded in March after two consecutive months of decline, but still remained at their lowest level since June 2022, as high LNG prices relative to lower domestic prices continued to weigh on demand.
Author: CK

Title: EU prepares countermeasures as US tariffs escalate trade tensions
Description: The European Commission is preparing further countermeasures in response to the sweeping US import tariffs set to take effect on Apr. 5, warning of economic disruptions and rising trade tensions. The measures apply across most sectors and come as the European Union remains the largest buyer of US LNG—possibly posing challenges to the EU’s energy security strategy, which leans heavily on US LNG.
Author: CK
